CatDescriptText: Mr. Dan Williams, Blackadore Street and Mrs. Frances Hurl, waitress, Bentley Drive, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 9, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "In your opinion, what do you think is the most effective protest medium Negro people have today?" Mr. Dan Williams' answer reads: "The best way is turning the other cheek--letting them know that you know they've done or are doing wrong, but not trying to get revenge.  Revenge belongs only to God."  Mrs. Frances Hurl's answer reads: "I think everybody should be treated the same.  I think church groups are one of the most effective ways to protest."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Dan Williams wearing eyeglasses and dark Gulf uniform with cap and zippered jacket, posed in front of building; Portrait of Frances Hurl wearing eyeglasses and finely checkered coat with wide collar trimmed in short dark fringe, and two dark buttons, standing on sidewalk, Downtown
